meanings.definition: Full of or covered with protuberances; knobby.
meanings.sent1: The tree trunk was torose, with many bumps and lumps.
meanings.sent2: Her torose skin felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The torose potato looked like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The old book had a torose cover, worn from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The torose surface of the moon was visible through the telescope.

meanings.definition: Having a twisted or gnarled appearance.
meanings.sent1: The torose branches of the ancient tree reached out in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The torose roots of the plant twisted around rocks in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The torose vines in the garden seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His torose hair stood up in wild tufts after a long day outside.
meanings.sent5: The torose path through the forest was like a maze of twisted wood.
